All Classes

Class
Description
AllFloorplanTests
 
BSPBranch
BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates.
BSPBuilder
This class has the responsibility to obtain the tree of BSP nodes for a given maze.
BSPLeaf
A leaf node for a tree of BSPNodes.
BSPNode
BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates.
CardinalDirection
Represents absolute directions as for a map to match with the orientation on the screen, i.e.
ColorTheme
This class encapsulates the selection of colors for the game.
ColorTheme.ColorThemeSelection
 
ColorTheme.MazeColors
MazeColors enumerates color choices for specific purposes.
CompassRose
A component that draws a compass rose.
Constants
This class contains all constants that are used in the maze package and shared among several classes.
Constants.UserInput
 
Control
Class handles the user interaction through the different stages of the game.
DefaultOrder
DefaultOrder provides a basic implementation for an order to interact with a MazeFactory by implementing the Order interface and to cater to a client class of the factory that wants to generate a maze.
Distance
This class has the responsibility to provide the distance for each cell to the exit of a maze.
DistanceSensor
A DistanceSensor provides information how for it is to a wall for a given position and in a specific direction.
Factory
Specifies functionality of a maze factory that produces a maze with a background thread.
FirstPersonView
This class encapsulates all functionality for drawing the current view at the maze from a first person perspective.
Floorplan
This class represents the floorplan of a maze.
FloorplanTest
Tests individual methods of the Floorplan class.
FloorplanTestIterator
 
ListOfWallsBuilder
This class creates a list of walls for a floorplan.
Map
This class encapsulates all functionality to draw a map of the overall maze, the set of visible walls, the solution.
Maze
A Maze encapsulates all relevant information about a maze that can be explored in a game.
MazeBuilder
This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix.
MazeBuilderBorukva
A maze generation class that builds a maze using Boruvka's algorithm.
MazeBuilderPrim
This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix.
MazeContainer
Class encapsulates access to all information that constitutes a maze.
MazeFactory
This class encapsulates how a maze is generated.
MazeFileReader
This class provides functionality to read the content of a Maze object from a file.
MazeFileWriter
This class provides functionality to write a maze configuration to a file in an XML format.
MazePanel
Add functionality for double buffering to an AWT Panel class.
Order
An order describes functionality needed to order a maze from the maze factory.
Order.Builder
Lists all maze generation algorithms that are supported by the maze factory (Eller needs to be implemented for P2)
RangeSet
Class stores a set of ranges, i.e., intervals.
ReliableRobot
 
ReliableSensor
 
Robot
This interface specifies methods to operate a robot that is inside a maze at a particular location and looking in a particular direction.
Robot.Direction
Describes all possible directions from the point of view of the robot, i.e., relative to its current forward position.
Robot.Turn
Describes all possible turns that a robot can do when it rotates on the spot.
RobotDriver
This interface specifies a robot driver that operates a robot to escape from a given maze.
SensorFailureAndRepairProcess
 
SimpleScreens
Implements the screens that are displayed whenever the game is not in the playing state.
SingleRandom
This class implements the generation of pseudo random numbers with a single instance of a random number generator.
State
The state interface is used for the controller such that all states of the UI conform and can be treated the same way.
StateGenerating
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the second stage where the user sees a progress bar while a maze is generated by the factory.
StatePlaying
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the third stage where the user plays the game.
StateTitle
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the first stage where the user can select the skill-level.
StateWinning
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the final stage where the user sees the final screen and can restart the game.
UnreliableRobot
 
UnreliableSensor
 
Wall
A wall is a continuous sequence of wallboards in the maze.
Wallboard
Basic class to describe a wallboard which is located at a cell (x,y) and at that cell it is located in a particular direction.
WallFollower
 
Wizard
